newsitem.title: UK: NatWest down again after results.
newsitem.headline: NatWest down again after results.

text.p: Shares in National Westminster Bank Plc fell on Thursday, extending a recent retreat amid further reaction to Tuesday's results and as a report in the Guardian said the bank's own analyst was cautious on the stock
NatWest shares, which hit a record 845p on February 10 -- up some 23 percent since the end of 1996 -- were down 10-1/2p at 763-1/2 by 1145 GMT in active trade of 3.9 million shares.

Dealers said there had been a continued surplus of stock in the market. "The market was still long, there has been some indigestion in the market, but they are now at a level where there has been some support," said one market-maker.
NatWest shares rose sharply in the early weeks of this year after lagging the sector for much of 1996.
Separately the Guardian said NatWest Securities analyst Mark Eady put a "hold" rating on the stock and said there was better value elsewhere in the sector.

It said Eady had lowered his earnings estimates for NatWest, which on Tuesday posted a 27 percent rise in underlying pre-tax profit to 1.12 billion stg but warned that it expected growth to slow and it was taking a more cautious approach to lending.
Eady was not immediately available for comment.
Others said NatWest and the rest of the banking sector was always likely to quieten down after the results season.
"The sector has been extremely strong and it tends to go a bit quiet after the results," said one senior fund manager. "Our view is that we are still happy with the stock and happy with the sector."
Among other bank stocks, Barclays Plc was down 1p at 11.26 stg and Lloyds TSB Plc was up 1-1/2p at 515-1/2.
